name: Pityriasis Rosea
chief_complaint: I developed a large pink patch on my chest last week, and now I'm getting smaller spots all over my trunk
symptoms: Herald patch appearing 1-2 weeks before other lesions
Patches following skin lines in 'christmas tree' pattern
physical_findings: Single 2-4cm herald patch with fine scale
Multiple smaller oval lesions with collarette scaling
Lesions aligned along skin tension lines
prognosis: Self-limiting condition that typically resolves within 6-8 weeks without scarring
description: A common acute exanthem characterized by a distinctive pattern of salmon-colored, scaly patches that typically begin with a herald patch followed by a widespread secondary eruption
